Package pl.project.commands

Class Command

java.lang.Object
pl.project.commands.Command
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckInCommand, CheckOutCommand, HelpCommand, InvalidCommand, ListCommand, PricesCommand, SaveCommand, ViewCommand
public abstract class Command extends Object
The Command class is an abstract base class for all command classes in the system. It defines the structure for executing commands related to hotel management, such as checking in, checking out, viewing rooms, and more. Specific commands extend this class and implement the execute method.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public abstract void execute(Hotel hotel) throws RoomNotExist, RoomNotAvailable, WrongInput, RoomAvailable
      Executes the specific command logic. Each subclass must provide its own implementation of this method.
      Parameters:
      hotel - the hotel object on which the command will be executed.
      Throws:
      RoomNotExist - if the room does not exist.
      RoomNotAvailable - if the room is not available for check-in or booking.
      WrongInput - if the input provided by the user is invalid.
      RoomAvailable - if the room is already available (e.g., during check-out).

    • getRoomUpper

      public Room getRoomUpper(Hotel hotel, Scanner scanner) throws RoomNotExist, WrongInput
      Prompts the user to enter a room number and fetches the corresponding room from the hotel.
      Parameters:
      hotel - the hotel object containing rooms.
      scanner - the scanner used to capture user input.
      Returns:
      the room object corresponding to the entered room number.
      Throws:
      RoomNotExist - if the room does not exist.
      WrongInput - if the user input is invalid (e.g., not a number).
